item.text: Then one day Jonathan son of Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Come on, let’s go over to the Philistine garrison that is opposite us.” But he did not let his father know.
Now Saul was sitting under a pomegranate tree in Migron, on the outskirts of Gibeah. The army that was with him numbered about 600 men.

Now Ahijah was carrying an ephod. He was the son of Ahitub, who was the brother of Ichabod and a son of Phinehas, son of Eli, the priest of the Lord in Shiloh. The army was unaware that Jonathan had left.
Now there was a steep cliff on each side of the pass through which Jonathan intended to go to reach the Philistine garrison. One cliff was named Bozez, the other Seneh.
The cliff to the north was closer to Micmash, the one to the south closer to Geba.

Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, “Come on, let’s go over to the garrison of these uncircumcised men. Perhaps the Lord will intervene for us. Nothing can prevent the Lord from delivering, whether by many or by a few.”
His armor-bearer said to him, “Do everything that is on your mind. Do as you’re inclined. I’m with you all the way!”
Jonathan replied, “All right. We’ll go over to these men and fight them.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> they <st data-num="03541 0559">say</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> us, ‘<st data-num="01826" class="">Stay put</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> we <st data-num="05060 0413">approach</st> you,’ we will <st data-num="05975" class="">stay</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08478" class="">right there</st> and <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">go up</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them.
But if they say, ‘Come up against us,’ we will go up. For in that case the Lord has given them into our hand—it will be a sign to us.”
When they made themselves known to the Philistine garrison, the Philistines said, “Look! The Hebrews are coming out of the holes in which they hid themselves.”

Then the men of the garrison said to Jonathan and his armor-bearer, “Come on up to us so we can teach you a thing or two!” Then Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, “Come up behind me, for the Lord has given them into the hand of Israel!”
Jonathan crawled up on his hands and feet, with his armor-bearer following behind him. Jonathan struck down the Philistines, while his armor-bearer came along behind him and killed them.
In this initial skirmish Jonathan and his armor-bearer struck down about 20 men in an area that measured half an acre.
Then fear overwhelmed those who were in the camp, those who were in the field, all the army in the garrison, and the raiding bands. They trembled and the ground shook. This fear was caused by God.
Saul’s watchmen at Gibeah in the territory of Benjamin looked on as the crowd of soldiers seemed to melt away first in one direction and then in another.

So <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> was <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him, “<st data-num="06485 04994">Muster the troops</st> and <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> <st data-num="04310" class="">who</st> is <st data-num="01980" class="">no longer</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> us.” When they <st data-num="06485" class="">mustered the troops</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03129" class="">Jonathan</st> and his <st data-num="03627" class="">armor</st>-<st data-num="05375" class="">bearer</st> <st data-num="02009 0369">were not there</st>.

So <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="0281" class="">Ahijah</st>, “<st data-num="05066" class="">Bring near</st> the <st data-num="0646" class="">ephod</st>,”<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> at <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">wearing</st> the <st data-num="0646">ephod</st> in front of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>.<n id="2" />
While Saul spoke to the priest, the panic in the Philistines’ camp was becoming greater and greater. So Saul said to the priest, “Withdraw your hand.”
Saul and all the army assembled and marched into battle, where they found the Philistines in total panic killing one another with their swords.

The <st data-num="05680" class="">Hebrews</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> had <st data-num="01961 0865 08032">earlier</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">gone</st> <st data-num="05973 05439">over</st> to the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> <st data-num="04264" class="">side</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01571 01992 01961 05973">joined</st> the <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelites</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> and <st data-num="03129" class="">Jonathan</st>.

When <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0376 03478">Israelites</st> who had <st data-num="02244" class="">hidden</st> themselves in the <st data-num="02022" class="">hill country</st> of <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> had <st data-num="05127" class="">fled</st>, <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">too</st> <st data-num="01692 0310">pursued</st> them in <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>.
So the Lord delivered Israel that day, and the battle shifted over to Beth Aven.

Now the men of Israel were hard pressed that day, for Saul had made the army agree to this oath: “Cursed be the man who eats food before evening. I will get my vengeance on my enemies!” So no one in the army ate anything.
Now the whole army entered the forest, and there was honey on the ground.

When the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="0935 0413">entered</st> the <st data-num="03293" class="">forest</st>, they <st data-num="02009" class="">saw</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01706" class="">honey</st> <st data-num="01982" class="">flowing</st>, but <st data-num="0369" class="">no</st> one <st data-num="05381 03027 0413 06310">ate</st> any of it,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">was afraid of</st> the <st data-num="07621" class="">oath</st>.

But <st data-num="03129" class="">Jonathan</st> had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard about</st> the <st data-num="07650" class="">oath</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> had <st data-num="07650" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">take</st>. He <st data-num="07971" class="">extended</st> the <st data-num="07097" class="">end</st> of his <st data-num="04294" class="">staff</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> was in his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> and <st data-num="02881" class="">dipped</st> it in the <st data-num="03295 01706">honeycomb</st>. When he <st data-num="07725 03027 0413 06310">ate</st> it,<n id="1" /> his <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> <st data-num="0215" class="">gleamed</st>.<n id="2" />

Then <st data-num="0376" class="">someone</st> from the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="06030 0559">informed</st> him, “Your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">under</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">a strict</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">oath</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, ‘<st data-num="0779" class="">Cursed</st> be the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eats</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">food</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">today</st>.’ That is why the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="05774" class="">is tired</st>.”

Then <st data-num="03129" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “My <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> has <st data-num="05916" class="">caused trouble for</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>. <st data-num="07200 04994">See</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">how</st> my <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> <st data-num="0215" class="">gleamed</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">when</st> I <st data-num="02938" class="">tasted</st> just a <st data-num="04592" class="">little</st> of <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01706" class="">honey</st>.
Certainly if the army had eaten some of the enemies’ provisions that they came across today, would not the slaughter of the Philistines have been even greater?”
On that day the army struck down the Philistines from Micmash to Aijalon, and they became very tired.
So the army rushed greedily on the plunder, confiscating sheep, cattle, and calves. They slaughtered them right on the ground, and the army ate them, blood and all.
Now it was reported to Saul, “Look, the army is sinning against the Lord by eating even the blood.” He said, “All of you have broken the covenant! Roll a large stone over here to me.”

Then Saul said, “Scatter out among the army and say to them, ‘Each of you bring to me your ox and sheep and slaughter them in this spot and eat. But don’t sin against the Lord by eating the blood.’” So that night each one brought his ox and slaughtered it there.
Then Saul built an altar for the Lord; it was the first time he had built an altar for the Lord.

<st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “Let’s <st data-num="03381" class="">go down</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> at <st data-num="03915" class="">night;</st> we will <st data-num="0962" class="">rout</st><n id="1" /> them <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="0216" class="">break</st> of <st data-num="01242" class="">day</st>.<n id="2" /> We <st data-num="03808" class="">won’t</st> <st data-num="07604" class="">leave</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">any</st> of them alive!”<n id="3" /> They <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="06213" class="">Do</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">whatever</st> <st data-num="05869" class="">seems</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">best</st> to you.”<n id="4" /> But the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “Let’s <st data-num="07126 0413">approach</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="01988" class="">here</st>.”
So Saul asked God, “Should I go down after the Philistines? Will you deliver them into the hand of Israel?” But he did not answer him that day.
Then Saul said, “All you leaders of the army come here. Find out how this sin occurred today.
For as surely as the Lord, the deliverer of Israel, lives, even if it turns out to be my own son Jonathan, he will certainly die!” But no one from the army said anything.
Then he said to all Israel, “You will be on one side, and I and my son Jonathan will be on the other side.” The army replied to Saul, “Do whatever you think is best.”

Then Saul said, “O Lord God of Israel! If this sin has been committed by me or by my son Jonathan, then, O Lord God of Israel, respond with Urim. But if this sin has been committed by your people Israel, respond with Thummim.” Then Jonathan and Saul were indicated by lot, while the army was exonerated.
Then Saul said, “Cast the lot between me and my son Jonathan!” Jonathan was indicated by lot.
So Saul said to Jonathan, “Tell me what you have done.” Jonathan told him, “I used the end of the staff that was in my hand to taste a little honey. I must die!”
Saul said, “God will punish me severely if Jonathan doesn’t die!”

But the army said to Saul, “Should Jonathan, who won this great victory in Israel, die? May it never be! As surely as the Lord lives, not a single hair of his head will fall to the ground, for it is with the help of God that he has acted today.” So the army rescued Jonathan from death.
Then Saul stopped chasing the Philistines, and the Philistines went back home.

After <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> had <st data-num="03920" class="">secured</st> his <st data-num="04410" class="">royal position</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, he <st data-num="03898" class="">fought</st> against <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0341" class="">enemies</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">on all sides</st>—the <st data-num="04124" class="">Moabites</st>, <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st>, <st data-num="0123" class="">Edomites</st>, the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> of <st data-num="06678" class="">Zobah</st>, and the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>. In <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> direction <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> he <st data-num="06437" class="">turned</st>, he was <st data-num="03467" class="">victorious</st>.<n id="2" />
He fought bravely, striking down the Amalekites and delivering Israel from the hand of its enemies.
The sons of Saul were Jonathan, Ishvi, and Malki-Shua. He had two daughters; the older one was named Merab and the younger Michal.

The <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> of <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> was <st data-num="0293" class="">Ahinoam</st>, the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="0290" class="">Ahimaaz</st>. The <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> of the <st data-num="08269" class="">general in command</st> of his <st data-num="06635" class="">army</st> was <st data-num="074" class="">Abner</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05369" class="">Ner</st>, <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul’s</st> <st data-num="01730" class="">uncle</st>.<n id="1" />
Kish was the father of Saul, and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Abiel.
There was fierce war with the Philistines all the days of Saul. So whenever Saul saw anyone who was a warrior or a brave individual, he would conscript him.
